The father lifted up his son and kissed him. He took the rebellious son to his breast, and he wrapped his own rich robe about the nearly naked form of his son. He took him to his heart with such warmth, and evinced such pity, if the son had ever doubted the goodness and love of his father, he could do so no longer. If he had 
                                                                           126
a sense of his sin when he decided to return to his father's house, he had a much deeper sense of his ungrateful course as he was thus received.
